text: Tang Dan (; born 27 January 1990) is a Chinese xiangqi player. In December 2016, she was China's top-ranking female player with ratings of 2525. Hailing from Anhui province, she moved to Beijing in 2004 to train under Zhang Qiang. She won her first national championships in 2007. In 2010, she won the gold medal at the Asian Games. She won the Women's World Championship in 2011, 2013 and 2017. ==References== Category:1990 births Category:Living people Category:Xiangqi players Category:Xiangqi players at the 2010 Asian Games Category:Asian Games medalists in xiangqi Category:Asian Games gold medalists for China Category:Medalists at the 2010 Asian Games
title: Tang Dan
